intro: Distimake weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's distimake, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, commonly known as the palm family, and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in dense panicles, which are often fragrant and attract various pollinators. Its leaves are long and pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental value in botanical gardens. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
